intro: Anacolosa luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon anacolosa, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It has a woody stem and produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
